thread.title: 'Constant explosions' at scene of catastrophic Melbourne plane crash
thread.title_full: 'Constant explosions' at scene of catastrophic Melbourne plane crash

title: 'Constant explosions' at scene of catastrophic Melbourne plane crash
text:
'Constant explosions' and fireballs at scene of catastrophic Melbourne plane crash By nine.com.au staff 
Witnesses have described terrible scenes of destruction and "constant explosions" where a charter aircraft carrying five people crashed into a Melbourne shopping centre. 
Five people are feared dead after the light plane plummeted from the sky shortly after take-off, crashing into popular Direct Factory Outlet just before 9am. 
The Beechcraft Super King twin engine aircraft was heading to King Island. 
Do you know more? Email 
Michael Howard, a tradie who witnessed the devastating crash, told 9News he saw a "blue flash" streak across the sky followed by a giant erupting fireball. "It was like something from a movie." Tradie Michael Howard watched the plane drop from the sky and smash into DFO. Source: 9News 
"I thought, 'what the hell' that doesn’t happen every day," Howard said. 
"It was like something from a movie." 
READ MORE: Five feared dead after plane crashes into DFO shopping centre in Melbourne 
Other witnesses told 9News of massive explosions. Carmel Brown was walking home close to DFO when she saw a red "mushroom" cloud. Five people are believed to have been on board a charter plane that crashed in a Melbourne direct factory outlet and exploded. Source: 9News 
"It was a huge explosion," said Daniel Stangherlin, a delivery driver on his schedule route when the plane came down. 
The plane had risen about 20 metres above the DFO roof before it pitched sharply and crashed, he said. 
"It was a huge explosion. 
"It was just shocking. You could feel the heat. It was pretty loud." 
Veronica Cvetoav, who works nearby to DFO, described a "bang like a bomb" and the building shaking. 
"There are explosions, constant explosions going off," a woman named Debbie described to radio station 3AW. The Beechcraft Super King twin engine aircraft was heading to King Island when it came in "low and fast" and hit DFO Essendon about 9am on Tuesday. Source: 9News 
"There is black smoke billowing into the sky. There are flames leaping up the side of the building." 
She said there was a "gaping hole" in the side of the DFO building. 
Another caller to the radio station told host Neil Mitchell he watched a plane encounter problems shortly after take-off. 
"I saw a small plane. It looked unusual, the way it was taking off, it didn't seem right," Frank said, who was driving past at the moment the air disaster was unfolding. 
"As it took off I thought 'that's not taking off right'", he said, adding that the plane seemed to be on embarking on an unusual flight path. 
"I looked in my rear view mirror and I saw a ball of flame." 
He said the point of impact was in the DFO loading area, right behind Adriatic Furniture and JB Hifi. A large exclusion zone is in place keeping media and the public away from the DFO. Source: 9News Thick black smoke from the crash could be seen across Melbourne. Source: 9News 
"It was a charter flight that was going to King Island, as we understand," Victorian Police Minister Lisa Neville told reporters. 
"There were five people on board the flight. 
"There's no status report on the condition of those who are in the aircraft or anyone yet at the DFO." 
The Essendon DFO wasn't due to open to customers until 10am. 
A large exclusion zone is in place keeping media and the public away from the DFO. © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017 TRENDING VIDEO 9RAW: Qld teen snapchats taxi driver abuse February 20, 2017: A Queensland teenager has filmed herself abusing a lost taxi driver on Snapchat.
